body.p: What is the molecular mass of tryptophan in amu (also called Daltons)? Click the " This table" link above to view the masses of the elements.

feedback.p: Incorrect. This is the total number of atoms, but not the same as the atomic weight.

Incorrect. This is the sum of the molecular weights of each type of atom, but remember that the number of each type of atom (there are 11 carbon atoms and 12 hydrogen atoms, etc) need to be considered as well.
Correct. The molecular mass of tryptophan is 204 amu or 204 daltons.
Incorrect. This is the product of the numbers of atoms. Check the equation again.

hint.p: Remember to multiply the number of each atom with the molecular mass of each atom.
C11 is the same as 11 carbons; 11 carbons = 11 * 12 amu = 132 amu.
